markdownRemark.html:
What is Flutter?

A tool for building native cross-platform apps (iOS and Android) with a single programming language and codebase. It’s also referred to as a SDK as it contains tools to compile Dart code into machine code that can be executed that both iOS and Android can read.

Flutter also contains a Widget library, resusable compoments and utility functions that can be used to build user interfaces.

Dart is an object-orietned and strongly typed language with similar syntax such as Javascript and Java.

Flutter is a framework, while Dart is the programming language.

The Flutter Architecture

Build user interfaces as code

  • A widget tree is built, a bit like the React component tree
  • Embraces platform specific code
  • A single codebase

How Dart gets complied to a native app

The Flutter sdk is responsible or compiling Dart code to machine code that can be run on iOS and Android.
